news_header: Venezuelan opposition candidate Edmundo González on pakotettu tunnustamaan Nicolás Maduro voittajaksi kiistellyissä vaaleissa.
news_text: Edmundo González, Venezuelan opposition candidate, claimed he was coerced into recognizing Nicolás Maduro as the winner of the disputed July elections before being granted asylum in Spain. In a video message, he stated that Maduro's aides pressured him to sign a letter while he was at the Spanish embassy in Caracas. However, Maduro's ally, Jorge Rodríguez, contended that González signed willingly. González described the signed letter as 'worthless' and emphasized his role as the 'president-elected' of many Venezuelans seeking change. Following his claims, Rodríguez threatened to release audio evidence contradicting González's statements. The Venezuelan electoral authorities declared Maduro the winner, but the opposition claims evidence of González's victory.
